member.name: ACL
member.summary: The ACL structure is the header of an access control list (ACL). A complete ACL consists of an ACL structure followed by an ordered list of zero or more access control entries (ACEs).

member.name: ACL.AclRevision
member.summary: Specifies the revision level of the ACL. This value should be ACL_REVISION, unless the ACL contains an object-specific ACE, in which case this value must be ACL_REVISION_DS. All ACEs in an ACL must be at the same revision level.

member.name: ACL.Sbz1
member.summary: Specifies a zero byte of padding that aligns the AclRevision member on a 16-bit boundary.

member.name: ACL.AclSize
member.summary: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the ACL. This value includes both the ACL structure and all the ACEs.

member.name: ACL.AceCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of ACEs stored in the ACL.

member.name: ACL.Sbz2
member.summary: Specifies two zero-bytes of padding that align the ACL structure on a 32-bit boundary.
